alert.note: Alert for Orange; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 7:28AM EDT until July 10 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Orange County in central Vermont... Eastern Windsor County in southern Vermont... * Until 130 PM EDT Monday. * At 728 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Woodstock, White River Junction, Chester, Hartland, Hartland Four Corners, Quechee, Hartford, Woodstock Village, Windsor, West Windsor, Pomfret, Reading, Weathersfield, Sharon, Norwich, Perkinsville Village, Cavendish, Baltimore, Royalton and Springfield. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
